subject: Re: How to test a static private function
msgSnippet: ... Taking a wild guess... I assume that you re passing null for the first parameter of invokeMethod, like this: PrivilegedAccessor.invokeMethod(null, ...);
messageBody:
--- "Prasad" <varaprasad_1261@y...> wrote:
> I used invokeMethod() of PreviligedAccesor class given in
> JUNIT FAQs. But its working for private methods only (not
> for static private methods). Any alternative other than this.

Taking a wild guess...
I assume that you're passing null for the first parameter of
invokeMethod, like this:
PrivilegedAccessor.invokeMethod(null, ...);
And that you're getting a NullPointerException in 'getMethod', when it
does 'instance.getClass()' on the null 'instance'.

If so, then you may have just found a bug in the PrivilegedAccessor
class. There are ways to fix or work around it.
